result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Roberson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Roberson in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for David Roberson.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Return on doctor's report.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report. State does not challenge Dr. Niess' report.  Defendant does challenge Dr. Niess' report.  Court qualified Dr. Jenna Niess to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.   Sworn for the State:  Dr. Jenna Niess.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Niess, Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings. Defense requests a scheduling conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Report 10.26.2022
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
Competency Evaluation Status Letter.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant David Roberson in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for David Roberson.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin via Zoom video conference.
Case in court for Return on Doctor's Report. Court in trial. Doctor requests extension to complete report. For reasons stated on the record, court grants request for adjournment.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Received and Filed: Competency Evaluation Extension Letter
Received and Filed.

Defendant David Roberson appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for David Roberson.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Proposed order; Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for signature.
Received and Filed.

Defendant David Roberson in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 02CF6763, 21CF785 & 21CF934. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Clementz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Katherine Graber; FILED.

Defendant David Roberson in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Attorney Graber to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defendant is reminded of the no contact order that remains in effect.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

22RM029395  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
06/10/2022

Court ordered no contact with Donajiah K. B.; Keishana S. M.;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David Roberson in court with Student Intern Damon Terrell under the supervision of attorney Jade K Hall. Defendant David Roberson in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Roberson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
